ygData.subject: RE: Re: Mid-level songs
ygData.msgSnippet: Your right, it does blink at a lower skill level(mine is at 200 now) but I not only remember it happening to me at lower levels but died several times and quit
ygData.messageBody:
Your right, it does blink at a lower skill level(mine is at 200 now) but I
not only remember it happening to me at lower levels but died several times
and quit using invis because of that. Now it never blinks and I live half my
life invisible it seems.

-----Original Message-----
From: John Kim [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Thursday, August 26, 1999 9:25 AM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Mid-level songs


From: John Kim <kim@...>

On Thu, 26 Aug 1999, Chris Kuenster (Entex) wrote:
>
> and the Lord. I never trust past experience with invis in any area I dont
> know as gospel. Unrest is one of those places you never know whats going
to
> happen next, I dont care how long you have played there.

Let me rephrase what I said:

Unless you can explain how a mob I'd safely walked through a
dozen times *in the previous 15 minutes* while invisible could
suddenly see me, I will go with the invisibility blinking off
as the explanation. :-)

It *does* blink off folks. I know you've all seen it happen
while resting (though thankfully it seems to have become rarer
as my wind skill is now up around 165). I don't understand
why people are so skeptical of the possibility of it blinking
off while in a mob's aggro radius.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: John Kim [mailto:kim@...]
> Sent: Thursday, August 26, 1999 8:48 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Mid-level songs
>
>
> From: John Kim <kim@...>
>
> On Thu, 26 Aug 1999, Talies the Wanderer wrote:
> > At 08:23 PM 8/25/99 -0400, you wrote:
> > >
> > >Almost every time I think something saw through my
> > >invisibility, I scroll back and the message immediately before
> > >I was attacked is "you become visible."
> >
> > Hrm - there has always been some error with the cause and effect timing.
> > Notice how whenever you are bashed, your song ends *before* the monster
> > bashes you? Methinks that they hit you, removing the invisibility. Now
> > how they saw you - well, who knows?
>
> Well, unless you can explain how a mob that I'd safely walked
> through a dozen times before while invisible could suddenly
> see me, I will go with the invisibility blinking off as the
> explanation. :-)
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
>
